snippet: Using airborne laser-scanning technology, archaeologists have been able to map the highly engineered landscape now hidden under jungle and rice fields that surrounded the ancient temple complex.
abstract: Study in journal The Proceedings of the National Academy of Sciences reports that lidar,  laser scanning technology, has allowed scientists to produce map of hidden remnants of urban landscape surrounding Cambodia's Angkor temples; surrounding urban landscape is much larger than researchers expected.
lead_paragraph: Using airborne laser-scanning technology, archaeologists have been able to map the highly engineered landscape now hidden under jungle and rice fields that surrounded the ancient temple complex.

headline.main: Angkor’s Urban Environs, Mapped From Above
headline.print_headline: Archaeology: Angkor’s Urban Environs, Mapped From Above

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Laser (Light Amplification by Stimulated Emission of Radiation)
